pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:0.4.eng: The subchapter on containing living beings

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu kosalesu janapade sāvatthiṃ gacchanto aññatarena gāmadvārena atikkamati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.2.eng: a monk who was traveling through the Kosalan country on his way to Sāvatthī walked through the gateway of a certain village.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.3.pli: Aññatarā itthī sāmikena saha bhaṇḍitvā gāmato nikkhamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ passitvā etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.3.eng: A woman who had had an argument with her husband walked through the same gateway. When she saw that monk, she asked him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.8.pli: Atha kho tassā itthiyā sāmiko gāmato nikkhamitvā manusse pucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.8.eng: Soon afterwards that woman’s husband also left that village. He asked around,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.11.pli: Atha kho so puriso anubandhitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ gahetvā ākoṭetvā muñci.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.11.eng: He then followed after them, caught that monk, and gave him a beating.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.12.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle padhūpento nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.12.eng: The monk sat down fuming at the foot of a tree.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.13.pli: Atha kho sā itthī taṃ purisaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.13.eng: And the woman said to her husband,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.15.pli: api ca ahameva tena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ gacchāmi;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.15.eng: I was the one who went with him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.18.pli: Atha kho so puriso taṃ bhikkhuṃ khamāpesi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.19.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu sāvatthiṃ gantvā bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.19.eng: That monk then went to Sāvatthī where he told the monks what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.20.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.20.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.21.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhu mātugāmena saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.21.eng: “How could a monk travel by arrangement with a woman?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.22.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, bhikkhu, mātugāmena saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.22.eng: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.25.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, mātugāmena saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjissasi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.27.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ, uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.27.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.28.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu mātugāmena saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjeyya, antamaso gāmantarampi, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.28.1.eng: ‘If a monk travels by arrangement with a woman, even just to the next inhabited area, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.6.pli: manussitthī, na yakkhī na petī na tiracchānagatā viññū paṭibalā subhāsitadubbhāsitaṃ duṭṭhullāduṭṭhullaṃ ājānituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.6.eng: a female human being, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal. She understands and is capable of discerning bad speech and good speech, what is indecent and what is decent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.10.pli: “gacchāma bhagini, gacchāmāyya, gacchāmāyya, gacchāma bhagini, ajja vā hiyyo vā pare vā gacchāmā”ti saṃvidahati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.10.eng: if he makes an arrangement like this: he says, “Let’s go,” and she replies, “Yes, let’s go, venerable;” or she says, “Let’s go, venerable,” and he replies, “Yes, let’s go;” or he says, “Let’s go today,” “Let’s go tomorrow,” or “Let’s go the day after tomorrow,” then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.11.eng: Even just to the next inhabited area:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.12.pli: kukkuṭasampāte gāme gāmantare gāmantare āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.12.eng: when the inhabited areas are a chicken’s flight apart, then for every next inhabited area he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.13.pli: Agāmake araññe addhayojane addhayojane āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.13.eng: When it is an uninhabited area, a wilderness, then for every six kilometers he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.13.comm: For a discussion of the yojana, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.1.pli: Mātugāme mātugāmasaññī saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjati, antamaso gāmantarampi, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.1.eng: If it is a woman, and he perceives her as such, and he travels by arrangement with her, even just to the next inhabited area, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.2.pli: Mātugāme vematiko saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjati, antamaso gāmantarampi, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.2.eng: If it is a woman, but he is unsure of it, and he travels by arrangement with her, even just to the next inhabited area, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.3.pli: Mātugāme amātugāmasaññī saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjati, antamaso gāmantarampi, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.3.eng: If it is a woman, but he does not perceive her as such, and he travels by arrangement with her, even just to the next inhabited area, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.4.pli: Bhikkhu saṃvidahati mātugāmo na saṃvidahati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.4.eng: If the monk makes an arrangement, but the woman does not express her agreement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.5.pli: Yakkhiyā vā petiyā paṇḍakena vā tiracchānagatamanussaviggahitthiyā vā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjati, antamaso gāmantarampi, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.5.eng: If he travels by arrangement with a female spirit, with a female ghost, with a paṇḍaka, with a female animal in the form of a woman, even just to the next inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.6.eng: If it is not a woman, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.7.eng: If it is not a woman, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.8.eng: If it is not a woman, and he does not perceive them as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.3.2.eng: if he goes, but not by arrangement;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.3.3.eng: if the woman has made an arrangement, but he has not expressed his agreement;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.3.4.eng: if he goes, but not according to the arrangement;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.3.7.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.3.8.eng: The training rule on arrangements, the seventh, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:0.4.eng: The subchapter on containing living beings

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena ariṭṭhassa nāma bhikkhuno gaddhabādhipubbassa evarūpaṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ hoti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.2.eng: At that time the monk Ariṭṭha, an ex-vulture-killer, had the following bad and erroneous view:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.3.pli: “tathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.3.eng: “As I understand the Teaching of the Buddha, the things he calls obstacles are unable to obstruct one who indulges in them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.5.pli: “ariṭṭhassa kira nāma bhikkhuno gaddhabādhipubbassa evarūpaṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.6.pli: ‘tathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā, te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā’”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.7.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū yena ariṭṭho bhikkhu gaddhabādhipubbo tenupasaṅkamiṃsu;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.8.eng: They went to him and asked,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira te, āvuso ariṭṭha, evarūpaṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.10.pli: ‘tathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā, te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā’”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.10.eng: that you have such a view?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.11.pli: “Evaṃ byā kho ahaṃ, āvuso, bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi— ‘yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā’”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.11.eng: “Yes, indeed. As I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, the things he calls obstacles are unable to obstruct one who indulges in them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.12.pli: “Mā, āvuso ariṭṭha, evaṃ avaca. Mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi. Na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ. Na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.12.eng: “No, Ariṭṭha, don’t misrepresent the Buddha, for it’s not good to misrepresent him. The Buddha would never say such a thing.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.13.pli: Anekapariyāyenāvuso ariṭṭha, antarāyikā dhammā antarāyikā vuttā bhagavatā. Alañca pana te paṭisevato antarāyāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.13.eng: The Buddha has given many discourses about the obstacles being obstructive and how they obstruct one who indulges in them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.14.pli: Appassādā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.14.eng: The Buddha has said that the enjoyment provided by worldly pleasures is small, whereas the suffering and trouble with them are huge, and so their drawbacks are greater.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.15.pli: Aṭṭhikaṅkalūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.15.eng: The Buddha has said that worldly pleasures are similar to a skeleton …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.16.eng: similar to a piece of meat …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.18.eng: similar to a pit of coals …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.21.eng: similar to fruits on a tree …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.22.eng: similar to a knife and chopping block …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.24.pli: sappasirūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.24.eng: similar to a snake’s head; the suffering and trouble with them are huge, and so their drawbacks are greater.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.25.pli: Evampi kho ariṭṭho bhikkhu gaddhabādhipubbo tehi bhikkhūhi vuccamāno tatheva taṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ thāmasā parāmāsā abhinivissa voharati—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.25.eng: But even though the monks corrected Ariṭṭha like this, he stubbornly held on to that bad and erroneous view, and continued to insist on it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.26.pli: “evaṃ byā kho ahaṃ, āvuso, bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi— ‘yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā, te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā’”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.27.pli: Yato ca kho te bhikkhū nāsakkhiṃsu ariṭṭhaṃ bhikkhuṃ gaddhabādhipubbaṃ etasmā pāpakā diṭṭhigatā vivecetuṃ, atha kho te bhikkhū yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.27.eng: Since they were unable to make him give up that view, they went to the Buddha and told him what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.28.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā ariṭṭhaṃ bhikkhuṃ gaddhabādhipubbaṃ paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.28.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned Ariṭṭha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.29.pli: “saccaṃ kira te, ariṭṭha, evarūpaṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.29.eng: “Is it true, Ariṭṭha, that you have such a view?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.30.pli: ‘tathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā’”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.31.pli: “Evaṃ byā kho ahaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi— ‘yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā’”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.32.pli: Kassa nu kho nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, mayā evaṃ dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāsi?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.32.eng: “Foolish man, who do you think I have taught like this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.33.pli: Nanu mayā, moghapurisa, anekapariyāyena antarāyikā dhammā antarāyikā vuttā. Alañca pana te paṭisevato antarāyāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.33.eng: Haven’t I given many discourses about the obstacles being obstructive and how they obstruct one who indulges in them?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.34.pli: Appassādā kāmā vuttā mayā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.34.eng: I have said that the enjoyment provided by worldly pleasures is small, whereas the suffering and trouble with them are huge, and so their drawbacks are greater.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.35.eng: I have said that worldly pleasures are similar to a skeleton …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.36.eng: similar to a piece of meat …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.38.eng: similar to a pit of coals …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.41.eng: similar to fruits on a tree …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.42.eng: similar to a knife and chopping block …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.44.pli: sappasirūpamā kāmā vuttā mayā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.44.eng: similar to a snake’s head; the suffering and trouble with them are huge, and so their drawbacks are greater.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.45.pli: Atha ca pana tvaṃ, moghapurisa, attanā duggahitena amhe ceva abbhācikkhasi, attānañca khaṇasi, bahuñca apuññaṃ pasavasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.45.eng: And yet, foolish man, by misunderstanding you have misrepresented me, hurt yourself, and made much demerit.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.46.pli: Tañhi te, moghapurisa, bhavissati dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.46.eng: This will be for your long-lasting harm and suffering.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.48.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.48.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.50.pli: ‘tathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā, te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā’ti
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.50.eng: “As I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, the things he calls obstacles are unable to obstruct one who indulges in them,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.51.eng: then the monks should correct him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.52.pli: ‘māyasmā evaṃ avaca, mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.52.eng: “No, venerable, don’t misrepresent the Buddha, for it’s not good to misrepresent the Buddha. The Buddha would never say such a thing.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.53.pli: anekapariyāyenāvuso, antarāyikā dhammā antarāyikā vuttā bhagavatā, alañca pana te paṭisevato antarāyāyā’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.53.eng: In many discourses the Buddha has declared the obstacles to be obstructive and how they obstruct one who indulges in them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.54.pli: Evañca so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi vuccamāno tatheva paggaṇheyya, so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsitabbo tassa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.54.eng: If that monk continues as before, the monks should press him up to three times to make him give up that view.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.55.pli: Yāvatatiyañce samanubhāsiyamāno taṃ paṭinissajjeyya, iccetaṃ kusalaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.55.eng: If he then gives it up, all is well.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:1.56.eng: If he does not, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.6.pli: “tathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.6.eng: “As I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, the things he calls obstacles are unable to obstruct one who indulges in them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.8.eng: the monk who speaks in that way.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.10.pli: aññehi bhikkhūhi. Ye passanti ye suṇanti tehi vattabbo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.10.eng: other monks, those who see it or hear about it. They should correct him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.10.comm: See Bu Ss 13:2.16 for the meaning of suṇanti in this context.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.11.pli: “māyasmā evaṃ avaca, mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.11.eng: “No, venerable, don’t misrepresent the Buddha, for it’s not good to misrepresent the Buddha. The Buddha would never say such a thing.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.12.pli: anekapariyāyenāvuso antarāyikā dhammā antarāyikā vuttā bhagavatā. Alañca pana te paṭisevato antarāyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.12.eng: In many discourses the Buddha has declared the obstacles to be obstructive and how they obstruct one who indulges in them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.13.eng: And they should correct him a second

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.15.eng: If he gives up that view, all is well.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.16.eng: If he does not, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.17.eng: If those who hear about it do not say anything, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.18.eng: That monk, even if he has to be pulled into the Sangha, should be corrected like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.19.pli: “māyasmā evaṃ avaca, mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.19.eng: “No, venerable, don’t misrepresent the Buddha, for it’s not good to misrepresent the Buddha. The Buddha would never say such a thing.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.20.pli: anekapariyāyenāvuso antarāyikā dhammā antarāyikā vuttā bhagavatā. Alañca pana te paṭisevato antarāyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.20.eng: In many discourses the Buddha has declared the obstacles to be obstructive and how they obstruct one who indulges in them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.21.eng: And they should correct him a second

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.23.eng: If he gives up that view, all is well.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.24.eng: If he does not, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.26.eng: “And, monks, he should be pressed like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.27.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.28.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.29.pli: Itthannāmassa bhikkhuno evarūpaṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.29.eng: Monk so-and-so has the following a bad and erroneous view:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.30.pli: “tathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā, te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.30.eng: “As I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, the things he calls obstacles are unable to obstruct one who indulges in them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.31.eng: He is not giving up that view.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.32.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ samanubhāseyya—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.32.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should press him

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.33.eng: to make him give it up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.35.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.36.pli: Itthannāmassa bhikkhuno evarūpaṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.36.eng: Monk so-and-so has the following bad and erroneous view:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.37.pli: “tathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā, te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.37.eng: “As I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, the things he calls obstacles are unable to obstruct one who indulges in them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.38.eng: He is not giving up that view.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.39.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ samanubhāsati tassā diṭṭhiyā paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.39.eng: The Sangha presses him to make him give it up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.40.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno samanubhāsanā, tassā diṭṭhiyā paṭinissaggāya, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.40.eng: Any monk who approves of pressing him to make him give it up should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.41.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.43.eng: A third time I speak on this matter:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.44.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.45.pli: Itthannāmassa bhikkhuno evarūpaṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.45.eng: Monk so-and-so has the following bad and erroneous view:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.46.pli: “tathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.46.eng: “As I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, the things he calls obstacles are unable to obstruct one who indulges in them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.47.eng: He is not giving up that view.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.48.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ samanubhāsati tassā diṭṭhiyā paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.48.eng: The Sangha presses him to make him give it up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.49.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno samanubhāsanā, tassā diṭṭhiyā paṭinissaggāya, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.49.eng: Any monk who approves of pressing him to make him give it up should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.50.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.51.pli: Samanubhaṭṭho saṅghena itthannāmo bhikkhu, tassā diṭṭhiyā paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.51.eng: The Sangha has pressed this monk to give up that view.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.52.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.52.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.53.eng: After the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.53.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.54.eng: After each of the first two announcements, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.55.eng: When the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.2.1.pli: Dhammakamme dhammakammasaññī na paṭinissajjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.2.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, and he does not give up his view, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.2.2.pli: Dhammakamme vematiko na paṭinissajjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.2.2.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, and he does not give up his view, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.2.3.pli: Dhammakamme adhammakammasaññī na paṭinissajjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.2.3.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he does not give up his view, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.2.4.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as legitimate, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.2.5.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.2.6.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.3.2.eng: if he has not been pressed;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.3.5.eng: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.3.5.comm: By editorial mistake the Pali is missing ādikammikassa, “the first offender”. This is a universal exception that applies to all the rules of the Vinaya.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.3.6.eng: The training rule on Ariṭṭha, the eighth, is finished.
